summary: An email from Assistant U.S. Attorney Alison Moe to law enforcement colleagues requesting investigative follow-up on Jeffrey Epstein, including obtaining provider information for a phone number from his SORNA registration, checking its WhatsApp account, and searching databases for a property at 301 E. 66th Street in New York linked to Epstein and potentially used to house models for his modeling agency MC2.

persons.name: Alison Moe
persons.context: Author of the email, requesting investigative steps regarding Jeffrey Epstein from law enforcement colleagues.

persons.name: Paul Byrne
persons.context: Recipient of the email, asked to assist with investigative requests related to Epstein.

persons.name: Amanda N. Young
persons.context: Recipient of the email, asked to assist with investigative requests related to Epstein.

persons.name: Abigail Kurland
persons.context: Copied on the email regarding investigative steps for the Epstein case.

persons.name: Alexander Rossmiller
persons.context: Copied on the email regarding investigative steps for the Epstein case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The individual whose phone number and property are the subject of the investigative requests; owner of the property at 301 E. 66th Street and associated with the modeling agency MC2.

connections.description: Moe, a federal prosecutor, is requesting investigative assistance from Byrne, an NYPD officer, regarding the Epstein case.
Moe, a federal prosecutor, is requesting investigative assistance from Young, an FBI agent, regarding the Epstein case.
Moe is a prosecutor involved in the investigation of Epstein, as evidenced by her directing inquiries into his phone records and property.
The property at 301 E. 66th Street is indicated as potentially housing models for Epstein's modeling agency, MC2.

events.title: Prosecutor requests investigative follow-up
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney Alison Moe emails law enforcement colleagues requesting specific investigative steps regarding Jeffrey Epstein's phone number and a New York property.

locations.context: A property that appears to be owned at least in part by Jeffrey Epstein, and where models for his modeling agency MC2 may have been provided housing.

locations.address: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
locations.context: The office address of Assistant U.S. Attorney Alison Moe in the Southern District of New York.

keyFacts: The document shows active federal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York as of December 2018.
Investigators are seeking information on a phone number (212-533-3739) associated with Epstein's SORNA (Sex Offender Registration and Notification Act) registration, including its WhatsApp account.
A property at 301 E. 66th Street in New York is identified as being owned at least in part by Epstein and potentially used to house models for his modeling agency MC2.
The email indicates coordination between federal prosecutors (AUSAs) and multiple law enforcement agencies (NYPD and FBI) in the Epstein investigation.
